bug.author: ishantanu
bug.summary: kubeflow generate errors out when --platform=minikube using kfctl 0.5.1
bug.description:
Hi, I tried installing kubeflow on minikube platform but generate errored out. The error is mentioned below: Command: kfctl generate all -V Output: <denchmark-code>Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for ksonnet: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: Failed to set param application components ["ambassador","argo","centraldashboard","jupyter-web-app","metacontroller","notebook-controller","pipeline","pytorch-operator","tensorboard","tf-job-operator"]: could not find component: extracting module and component names from application: "application" is not a component or a module Usage: kfctl generate [all(=default)|k8s|platform] [flags]
Flags: --email string email if '--platform gcp' -h, --help help for generate --hostname string hostname if '--platform gcp' --ipName string ipName if '--platform gcp' --mount-local mount-local if '--platform minikube' -V, --verbose verbose output default is false --zone string zone if '--platform gcp'
couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for ksonnet: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: Failed to set param application components ["ambassador","argo","centraldashboard","jupyter-web-app","metacontroller","notebook-controller","pipeline","pytorch-operator","tensorboard","tf-job-operator"]: could not find component: extracting module and component names from application: "application" is not a component or a module </denchmark-code>
Any idea what might be wrong?

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.74. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
What version of kfctl are you using?

Looks like that's the 0.5.1 version. What init command did you run? I can reproduce this <denchmark-code>kfctl init --platform=minikube /tmp/kftest-3573-minikube kfctl generate all </denchmark-code>
The following works <denchmark-code>/kfctl init --platform=gcp --skip-init-gcp-project /tmp/test-3473 cd /tmp/test-3473 kfctl general all -V </denchmark-code>
So it appears to be specific to minikube. Which would also explain why its not caught by our tests. As a work around I would suggest following these <denchmark-link:https://v0-5.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>instructions</denchmark-link>
to install Kubeflow on your existing cluster (minikube)

Oh okay. Well, I am able to install kubeflow on kind/ any other k8s cluster by following this guide. But, since the docs contain minikube specific content, I thought it's best to give it a try. I'll try to do this on a minikube cluster. Thanks.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> Just to confirm, I tried the docs for install on minikube and it works. So, I guess something's not right with ?
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
